revised_title: Anatomical Study of Tympanic Cavity and Palate Communications in Crocodilia
tldr: The author examines the anatomical structure of the tympanic cavity and palate in crocodiles, alligators, and gavials. They discovered a complex system of canals and foramina that connect the tympanic cavity to the palate, which is more intricate than previously thought. This study provides insights into the hearing and sound conduction mechanisms in these reptiles.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Osteology
